poem:
"An Ode to Unseen Heroes"

In Baltimore's morning blush, there is a whispered tale,
Of six men, all fathers, brothers, sons, who bravely set sail.
From lands of Latin rhythms, to build dreams of steel and stone,
Their names etched in the wreckage, their stories echo alone.
In silence we remember, Miguel Luna and his crew,
Unsung heroes of the skyline, their grit was ever true.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Details emerge on Baltimore bridge collapse victims: ‘They were wonderful family people’ The six men presumed dead in the Baltimore bridge collapse on Tuesday all appeared to be construction workers originally from Latin American countries, according to reports, including a father of three, Miguel Luna, from El Salvador, as authorities said they had recovered the black box recorder from the ship. Since the container ship Dali crashed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge after losing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
